document.docTitle: Hamacantha (Vomerula) klausruetzleri Castello-Branco & Hajdu 2018, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new Hamacantha (Vomerula) from the Rio Grande Rise (SW Atlantic) (Hamacanthidae, Porifera)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new Hamacantha (Vomerula) from the Rio Grande Rise (SW Atlantic) (Hamacanthidae, Porifera)

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURE 3. Holotype of Hamacantha (Ƒ.) klausruetzleri sp. nov. (MNRJ 17983). A) external morphology; B) Transversal section of skeleton; C) Styles; D) Strongyles; E) Larger diancistras; F) Smaller diancistras; G) Sigmas I and II; H) Sigmas I; I) Sigmas II. Scales: A) 5 mm; B) 100 µm; C–D) 50 µm; E, G) 20 µm; F–I) 10 µm.

materialsCitation.collectorName: Grande Rise, SW & R.W.M. Van Soest & Marion Dufresne'

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype .
MNRJ 17983 ,
Rio Grande Rise
, SW Atlantic (PROERG, ERG 61‒L2, ‒ 33.5747S / ‒ 31.0970W ), 1245‒
1165 m
depth, coll. R.V. ‘ Marion Dufresne’ , 2011.07.15.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This is the only species of
Hamacantha ( Vomerula )
with two types of megascleres (styles and strongyles), two categories of diancistras, and two categories of sigmas.

Description. The single specimen is a thin transparent crust,
16 x 15
mm in area, and 1 mm thick ( Fig. 3A ). Surface smooth, with no visible oscula. Consistency very soft and fragile. Colour alive not recorded, and transparent to off white in ethanol.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3. Holotype of
Hamacantha
(Ƒ.) klausruetzleri
sp. nov.
(MNRJ 17983). A) external morphology; B) Transversal section of skeleton; C) Styles; D) Strongyles; E) Larger diancistras; F) Smaller diancistras; G) Sigmas I and II; H) Sigmas I; I) Sigmas II. Scales: A) 5 mm; B) 100 µm; C–D) 50 µm; E, G) 20 µm; F–I) 10 µm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution and ecology. Known only from its type locality, the Rio Grande Rise (SW Atlantic), at about 1200 m depth.

Etymology. The species is named in honour of Dr. Klaus Rüetzler, for his outstanding contribution to our knowledge of coral reef sponges and for his inspirational taxonomic studies on W Atlantic sponges.

Remarks.
Hamacantha ( V .) klausruetzleri
sp. nov.
is the only species in
Hamacantha
with two different types of megascleres, styles and strongyles, as well as two categories of diancistras and sigmas. From all congeners occurring in the Atlantic, the new species appears closest to
H . ( V .) carteri
and
H . ( V .) esperioides
for the similar possession of styles, two categories of diancistras, and sigmas. Nevertheless none of them has a second category of megascleres and of sigmas as observed in
H . ( V .) klausruetzleri
sp. nov.
